title: Authorizes school districts to permit students who are home schooled to participate in non-academic classes and programs at public schools

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the education law, in relation to authorizing school
         districts to permit students who receive home instruction  to  partic-
         ipate in non-academic courses and programs at public schools

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph a of subdivision  2  of  section  3602-c  of  the
    2  education law, as amended by chapter 378 of the laws of 2007, is amended
    3  to read as follows:
    4    a.  Boards  of  education  of  all school districts of the state shall
    5  furnish services to students who are residents of  this  state  and  who
    6  attend  nonpublic  schools  located  in  such school districts, upon the
    7  written request of the parent or person in parental relation of any such
    8  student. BOARDS OF EDUCATION MAY ALSO FURNISH NON-ACADEMIC SERVICES  AND
    9  PROGRAMS  TO STUDENTS RESIDING IN THE DISTRICT WHO RECEIVE HOME INSTRUC-
   10  TION AT THE REQUEST OF THE PARENT OR PERSON IN PARENTAL RELATION OF  ANY
   11  SUCH  STUDENT. Such a request for career education or services to gifted
   12  students shall be filed with  the  board  of  education  of  the  school
   13  district  in  which  the  parent  or  person in parental relation of the
   14  student resides on or before the first day of June preceding the  school
   15  year  for  which  the  request  is  made.  In  the case of education for
   16  students with disabilities, such a request shall be filed with the trus-
   17  tees or board of education of the school  district  of  location  on  or
   18  before the first of June preceding the school year for which the request
   19  is  made,  or  by  July  first,  two thousand seven for the two thousand
   20  seven--two thousand eight  school  year  only,  provided  that  where  a
   21  student  is  first  identified  as a student with a disability after the

    1  first day of June preceding the school year for  which  the  request  is
    2  made, or thirty days after the chapter of the laws of two thousand seven
    3  which  amended  this paragraph, takes effect where applicable, and prior
    4  to  the  first  day  of  April of such current school year, such request
    5  shall be submitted within thirty days after such student is first  iden-
    6  tified.  For  students first identified after March first of the current
    7  school year, any such request for education for students with  disabili-
    8  ties  in  the  current  school  year that is submitted on or after April
    9  first of such current school year, shall be deemed a timely request  for
   10  such services in the following school year.
   11    S  2. Subdivision 2 of section 3602-c of the education law, as amended
   12  by chapter 474 of the laws of 2004, is amended to read as follows:
   13    2. Boards of education of all school  districts  of  the  state  shall
   14  furnish  services  to  pupils  who  are  residents of this state and who
   15  attend nonpublic schools located in  such  school  districts,  upon  the
   16  written request of the parent, guardian or persons legally having custo-
   17  dy of any such pupil.  BOARDS OF EDUCATION MAY ALSO FURNISH NON-ACADEMIC
   18  SERVICES  AND  PROGRAMS TO STUDENTS RESIDING IN THE DISTRICT WHO RECEIVE
   19  HOME INSTRUCTION AT THE REQUEST  OF  THE  PARENT,  GUARDIAN  OR  PERSONS
   20  HAVING CUSTODY OF ANY SUCH PUPIL. Such a request shall be filed with the
   21  board  of education of the school district in which the parent, guardian
   22  or persons legally having custody of the pupil resides on or before  the
   23  first  day  of  June  preceding the school year for which the request is
   24  made; provided that, in the case of education for students with disabil-
   25  ities, where a student is first identified as a student with a disabili-
   26  ty after the first day of June preceding the school year for  which  the
   27  request  is  made  and  prior  to the first day of April of such current
   28  school year or when a student with a disability establishes residence in
   29  the school district after June first of the preceding year and prior  to
   30  April  first of the current school year, such request shall be submitted
   31  within thirty days after such student is first identified or establishes
   32  residence in the district, as applicable. For students first  identified
   33  or  establishing residence after March first of the current school year,
   34  any such request for education for students  with  disabilities  in  the
   35  current  school  year  that is submitted on or after April first of such
   36  current school year, shall be deemed a timely request for such  services
   37  in the following school year. For the purpose of obtaining education for
   38  students with disabilities, as defined in paragraph d of subdivision one
   39  of  this  section,  such  request  shall be reviewed by the committee on
   40  special education in accordance with the provisions  of  section  forty-
   41  four  hundred  two  of this chapter. Review of the recommendation of the
   42  committee on special education may be obtained by the  parent,  guardian
   43  or  persons  legally  having  custody  of  the  pupil  pursuant  to  the
   44  provisions of section forty-four hundred  four  of  this  chapter.  Such
   45  school  district  shall  contract  with the school district in which the
   46  nonpublic school attended by the pupil is located, for the provision  of
   47  services  pursuant to this section, except that in the case of education
   48  for students with disabilities, the school  district  of  residence  may
   49  provide  such  services directly or by contract with the school district
   50  of location.
   51    S 3. Subdivision 6 of section 3602-c of the education law, as added by
   52  chapter 593 of the laws of 1974, is amended to read as follows:
   53    6. Boards of education are authorized to determine by resolution which
   54  courses of instruction, INCLUDING  NON-ACADEMIC  COURSES  AND  PROGRAMS,
   55  shall  be  offered, the eligibility of pupils to participate in specific
   56  courses, and the admission of pupils. All pupils in  like  circumstances

       A. 979                              3

    1  shall  be  treated similarly.  FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION STUDENTS
    2  WHO RECEIVE HOME INSTRUCTION SHALL RECEIVE THE  SAME  OPPORTUNITIES  FOR
    3  PARTICIPATION  IN  NON-ACADEMIC  COURSES  AND  PROGRAMS  AS STUDENTS WHO
    4  ATTEND NONPUBLIC SCHOOLS.
    5    S  4. This act shall take effect immediately, provided that the amend-
    6  ments to subdivision 2 of section 3602-c of the education  law  made  by
    7  section one of this act shall be subject to the expiration and reversion
    8  of such subdivision pursuant to section 22 of chapter 352 of the laws of
    9  2005,  as  amended, when upon such date the provisions of section two of
   10  this act shall take effect.
